Duke is an application for managing your tasks via a CLI while having the benefits of a simple GUI that is easy to use.
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or higher installed in your computer.
2. Download the latest release of `duke.jar` from [here](https://github.com/benedictchuajj/ip/releases)
3. Double-click on the jar file to start the application. You will see a GUI that is similar to this:
4. Input some commands to start using Duke! Here are some simple commands you can try:
* `todo try app` : Adds a ToDo task named `try app` to the task list.
* `list` : lists all tasks in the task list.
You can check out the [Features](https://github.com/benedictchuajj/ip/tree/master/docs#features) section for an extensive list of the commands available in Duke.
There are 3 types of tasks that you can add to the task list and this is how you can add them:
ToDo is a task that is not assigned to any dates.
To add a Todo to the list:
Deadline is a task that has a deadline.
To add a Deadline to the list:
where `dueDate` is given in *dd/mm/yyyy* and `dueTime` is given in the 24-hour format.
Event is a task that occurs during a stipulated timing.
To add an Event to the list:
where `eventDate` is given in *dd/mm/yyyy* and `startTime` & `endTime` is given in the 24-hour format.
Displays the tasks in the current task lists. There are a few ways to display the task with various filtering.
To list all tasks without any filtering:
#### Filter by date - List all tasks that occurs on a particular date
To list the tasks with a filtering based on a date:
#### Filter by description - List all tasks that has a keyword in the description
To list the tasks with a filtering based on a keyword:
where `filterKeyword` the text that you want to find in the task's description.
There are a few ways you can get reminders:
where `x` is one of the 3 arguments below:
* today - all upcoming tasks in the next 24 hours
* week - all upcoming tasks in the coming week
Tasks can be marked as being completed by inputting:
`done x` where `x` is the index of the task in the list.
You can also input multiple indexes to mark multiple tasks as completed:
`done i j k` where `i`, `j` and `k` are the indexes of the task in the list.
Tasks can be removed from the list by inputting:
`delete x` where `x` is the index of the task in the list.

| Add Deadline | `deadline TASK /by DATE TIME`
e.g., `deadline assignment submission /by 16/09/2021 1300` |

| Add Event | `event TASK /at DATE sTIME eTIME`
e.g., `event team meeting /at 11/09/2021 1200 1400` |

* The DukeException is an exception that is thrown when an error happens when Duke is running.
* It contains the exceptions that are thrown due to wrong inputs given and is specific to this version of Duke.
* @param message String containing the error message to be shown to the user.
* The EmptyDescriptionException is thrown when user attempts to add a task without descriptions.
super("BAKA! The description of a task cannot be empty!");
* The InvalidArgumentException is thrown when user types in a argument that is unrecognisable by Duke.
* @param command String containing the incorrect argument that the user has inputted.
super("BAKA! I don't understand this argument in your command!\n"
+ "You might want to check for spelling and potential whitespaces!");
* The InvalidCommandException is thrown when user types in a command that is unrecognisable by Duke.
* @param command String containing the incorrect command that the user has inputted.
super("BAKA! I don't understand this command!\n"
+ "You might want to check for spelling and potential whitespaces!");
* The InvalidDateInputException is thrown when the user gives a date that is not valid or not in an acceptable form.
* @param dateString String containing the date inputted in an incorrect format by the user.
super("BAKA! I don't understand this Date input!\n"
+ "It should be a valid date in the form dd-mm-yyyy, dd/mm/yyyy or yyyy-mm-dd!");
* The InvalidIndexException is thrown when user inputs an index that is out of bounds of the TaskList.
super(String.format("BAKA! Input a valid index!! You have %d tasks currently!", numOfTasks));
* The InvalidTimeInputException is thrown when user gives a time that is not valid or in an acceptable form.
* @param timeString String containing the time inputted in a wrong format by the user.
super("BAKA! I don't understand this Time input!\n"
+ "It should be a valid time in the form HH:MM or HHMM!");
* The MissingArgumentException is thrown when the user did not input relevant arguments for their commands.
super(String.format("BAKA! You're missing the %s argument to add a %s!", tag, type));
* The MissingIndexException is thrown when the user did not input the index for certain commands.
super("BAKA! You need to provide an index so I know which task you are referring to!");

* Class to deal with making sense of the user's inputted command.
